__e: My dear little girl Hasn't mummy told you there aren't any wolves?
No! The poor dear is right where she belongs!
A destitute woman and her small child, what can they do to such a man if he keeps their money for himself?
But when I tell the poor lady about him, she says to me, "thank you," like I did the right thing.
But after all this time, what should we do with the old woman?
It's my fault this poor girl got killed. It's my fault.
You know as well as I do that it was her fault the poor girl died.
What happened to that poor girl was horrible.
I would gladly hurt you for what did to that poor girl, hurt you badly.
You're that poor little girl who lost her baby, aren't you?
I mean, after what he'd done to that poor girl?
What the three of us did to that poor girl...
"What the three of us did to that poor girl."
You took my normal daughter and told everyone she's a married woman!
Seems a mistake. She'll come watch you when she can.
What can I say to these poor men?
There are only poor folk here.
The poor creature died on me.
I fear to think what he intends for the poor creature.
Six years without letting me see once that poor creature!
